alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 9:59AM EST until March 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches leading to totals of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Southern Erie county. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will occur through 4 PM when rates can exceed 1 inch per hour at times. Heavy snow rates will be required for roadway accumulations through this afternoon. Snow will lessen in intensity this evening but will have greater potential to stick to roads as the sun sets.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
